description.para: The Account Manager class (AMGR) holds all necessary information to control the access by user login request tothe BTS. It contains the authorization matrix and all user accounts. It controls the order of account lookup in case that remote user information management is running in parallel to the BTS. It furthermore provides actions to read the own account information (except the password).
AMGR is a singleton. Exactly 1 instance of AMGR is created at system startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.
This parameter identifies the account manager. The value is always 1.

description.para: 16.01.2014 Nittala: Parameter added.
Allow user to timeout pairing relationship after the configured number of hours.

If it is set to 0: Immediately clear all pairing relationships and connections at time of configuration change; no subsequent pairing or connections allowed until Pairing Relationshio Timout changed to a non-zero value.
If it is set to 169 : Do not automatically timeout pairing relationships;
If it is set to the value between 1 and 168, the value is the timeout in hours. Once the age of a pairing relationship reaches the timeout, BTS will automatically timeout the pairing relationship.

If the device is connected at the time of pairing timeout, the device is not forcibly disconnected by the pairing timeout. However, subsequent connection after expired pairing relationship will require a fresh pairing.

shortDesc.para: Allow operator to timeout pairing relationships

description.para: Added per LTE1702 (FlexiZone Micro Bluetooth Support) on May 21, 2013. The feature is not in the pick list at the time when the parameter is entered.

Allow operator to configure a persistent Bluetooth device whitelist and blacklist.

If the list contains at least one whitelisted device, only whitelisted devices may connect to or pair with the BTS. Otherwise, if the list contains blacklisted devices, the blacklisted devices can NOT connect to or pair with the BTS.

shortDesc.para: Persistent Bluetooth device whitelist/blacklist.

description.para: 24-05-2012,lucy: Corrected default value as per WBTS_SEC_47274 for PR87396ESPE04
The Ethernet Link Interface (ETHLK) class represents a single physical Ethernet link interface of the BTS.

All instances of ETHLK are created at startup by the BTS. The number of instances depends on the type of the hardware unit that is installed onto the BTS. The instances of ETHLK cannot be deleted by the management system.
If the value of acceptableFrameTypes is "AdmitTagged", the device will discard untagged and Priority-tagged frames received on this interface.

If the value is “AdmitAll”, tagged, untagged and Priority-tagged frames received on this interface will be accepted. Untagged and Priority-tagged frames are assigned to the VLAN defined by the portDefaultVlanId for this interface.

shortDesc.para: If the value of acceptableFrameTypes is "AdmitTagged", the device will discard untagged and Priority-tagged frames received on this interface.

If the value is “AdmitAll”, tagged, untagged and Priority-tagged frames received on this interface will be accepted. Untagged and Priority-tagged frames are assigned to the VLAN defined by the portDefaultVlanId for this interface.

additionalInfo.para: Notes:
1) Priority tagged" frames (IEEE 802.1Q tagged frames with VLAN ID=0) can be configured via the VLAN filter list of parameter l2VlanIdList.

2) Ethernet management frames (i.e. Synchronous Ethernet and Ethernet OAM frames) are always allowed to ingress and egress the Ethernet interface of the layer 2 switch independent of the status of the value of the discardUntagged parameter.

This parameter specifies the IP address to be used for control plane traffic. The IP address may collapse with a network interface IP address. If it does not collapse with a network interface IP address, it is considered to be virtual.

To be entered in dotted decimal format.

The control plane IP address may also collapse with the uPlaneIpAddress, the mPlaneIpAddress and the sPlaneIpAddress.
To be entered in dotted decimal format.

description.para: 2011-05-17: JTh: New PSD "PAR MigrateSpecialForSwUpgrade" to resolve PR 86394ESPE02

This parameter specifies the administrator preference for how the NE should select its serving OMS. Automatic selection (value "automatic") means that the NE autonomously selects its serving OMS based on availability of the configured primary or secondary OMS. The NE may also be administratively assigned/locked to either the configured primary or the configured secondary OMS (values "primaryForced" and "secondaryForced").

shortDesc.para: Administrator setting for serving OMS.

pRefDesc.para: To be able to switch to the secondary OMS, either autonomously or via administrative switch-over, or to administratively assign/lock to the secondary OMS, the secondary OMS IP address must have a valid value.

When the serving OMS administrative setting is "primaryForced" or "secondaryForced", and the current serving OMS is different from that in the serving OMS administrative setting, a switch-over is implicit and a separate switch-over request is not needed.

QOS is a singleton. Exactly 1 instance of QOS is created at startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.

p.name: dscpMap
p.fullName: Table for mapping DSCPs to PHBs and PCP bits

description.para: This tables maps Diff Servce Code Point (DSCP) values to Per Hop Behaviours (PHB) and VLAN priority bit (PCP) values.
The table has as most 64 entries, one for each possible DSCP value. For non-configured DSCP values, the following defaults are used:
dscp: not configured
pHB: Best Effort
vlanPrio: 0.

shortDesc.para: This tables maps Diff Servce Code Point (DSCP) values to Per Hop Behaviours (PHB) and VLAN priority bit (PCP) values.
The table has as most 64 entries, one for each possible DSCP value. For non-configured DSCP values, the following defaults are used:
dscp: not configured
pHB: Best Effort
vlanPrio: 0.

feature.name: LTE131 Traffic prioritization on IP layer (Diffserv)

featureComponent.name: LTE131 Traffic prioritization on IP layer (Diffserv)

description.para: This parameter designates a per hop behaviour wird drop precedence within the PHB class group for Assured Forwarding (AF) or the PHB classes Best Effort (BE) or Expedited Forwarding (EF).

4 PHB classes are defined within the Assured Forwarding group (AF1 to AF4) and three drop precedences within each class. Within each class the drop precedence is as follows: 1 (e.g. AF41) = low drop precedence, 2 (e.g. AF42) = medium drop precedence and 3 ( e.g. AF43) = high drop precedence.

shortDesc.para: This parameter designates a per hop behaviour wird drop precedence within the PHB class group for Assured Forwarding (AF) or the PHB classes Best Effort (BE) or Expedited Forwarding (EF).

4 PHB classes are defined within the Assured Forwarding group (AF1 to AF4) and three drop precedences within each class. Within each class the drop precedence is as follows: 1 (e.g. AF41) = low drop precedence, 2 (e.g. AF42) = medium drop precedence and 3 ( e.g. AF43) = high drop precedence.

p.name: perHopBehaviourWeightList
p.fullName: Per Hop Behaviour queue weight list

description.para: This is a set of 5 weight values for the traffic queues associated to the Per Hop Behaviours:
- Assured Forwarding 4 (AF4)
- Assured Forwarding 3 (AF3)
- Assured Forwarding 2 (AF2)
- Assured Forwarding 1 (AF1)
- Best Effort (BE.
Weight value range is between 1 and 10.000.

shortDesc.para: This is a set of 5 weight values for the traffic queues associated to the Per Hop Behaviours:
- AF4
- AF3
- AF2
- AF1
- BE.
Weight value range is between 1 and 10.000.

additionalInfo.para: The FTM has also a queue for PHB Expedited Traffic (EF). This is however not a weighted but a strict queue.

p.name: trafficTypesMap
p.fullName: Table for mapping traffic types to DSCPs

description.para: This tables maps traffic types to DSCP values.
In this release the table contains entries for
- Control plane traffic
- ICMP traffic
- IPSec IKE traffic
- Management plane traffic
- Synchronization plane traffic
- BFD1 to BFD16
- Site support equipment (SSE).(This is not supported for FlexiZone Micro)
- ICMP Neighbour Solicitation/Advertisement and MLD messages(HighPrioICMPv6). (This is supported only in FSMR3 and FlexiZone Micro HW)
The default mapping is as follows:
TrafficType DSCP (PHB)
CPLANE: 46 (EF)
ICMP: 10 (AF11)
IKE: 34 (AF41)
MPLANE: 34 (AF41)
SPLANE: 46 (EF)
BFD1 to BFD16: 34 (AF41)
SSE: 10 (AF11)
HighPrioICMPv6:56 (EF)

shortDesc.para: This tables maps traffic types to DSCP values. In this release the table contains entries for:
- Control plane traffic
- ICMP traffic
- IPSec IKE traffic
- Management plane traffic
- Synchronization plane traffic
- BFD1 to BFD16
- Site support equipment (SSE).(This is not supported in FlexiZone Micro)
- ICMP Neighbour Solicitation/Advertisement and MLD messages(HighPrioICMPv6).(This is supported only in FSMR3 and FlexiZone Micro HW)
The paramter support FTLB and FTIB HW Values.

additionalInfo.para: The default mapping is as follows:
TrafficType DSCP (PHB)
CPLANE: 46 (EF)
ICMP: 10 (AF11)
IKE: 34 (AF41)
MPLANE: 34 (AF41)
SPLANE: 46 (EF)
BFD1 to BFD16: 34 (AF41)
SSE: 10 (AF11)
HighPrioICMPv6:56 (EF)

This parameter specifies a traffic type.
Allowed values are:
CPLANE: Signalling transport (C-plane) between eNB and MME (S1AP protocol) and signalling transport between eNB nodes (X2AP protocol).
ICMP: ICMP traffic with high and low priority.
IKE: IPSec IKE traffic.
MPLANE: Transport of O&M data between eNB and the OPS System with high and low priority.
SPLANE: Synchronization plane traffic (Timing over Packet)
BFD(BFD1 to BFD16): Bidirectional Forwarding Detection
SSE: Site Support Equipment
HighPrioICMPv6: ICMPv6 traffic with high and low priority.

shortDesc.para: It specifies a traffic type.Allowed values are:
CPLANE:Signalling transport(C-plane)between eNB & MME(S1AP protocol)& signalling transport between eNB nodes(X2AP protocol).
ICMP:ICMP traffic with high&low priority.
IKE:IPSecIKE traffic.
MPLANE:Transport of O&M data between eNB & the OPS System with high&low priority.
SPLANE:Synchronization plane traffic(TOP)
BFD(BFD1 to BFD16):Bidirectional Forwarding Detection
SSE:Site Support Equipment
HighPrioICMPv6:ICMPv6 traffic with high&low priority

The Clock Synchronization class (SYNC) represents the synchronization functionality of the BTS. It refers to the currently active clock synchronization source of the BTS. It also configures the internal clock.
SYNC is a singleton. Exactly 1 instance of SYNC is created at system startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.

This parameter specifies the configured priority 1 for this Timing over Packet master. Lower values mean higher preference for selecting the ToP master as provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal.
range is 0..255 if Announce messages are requested from all masters
range is 1..255 if Announce messages are requested only from highest priority master

shortDesc.para: This parameter specifies the configured priority 1 for this Timing over Packet master. Lower values mean higher preference for selecting the ToP master as provider of the Timing over Packet clock signal.
range is 0..255 if Announce messages are requested from all masters
range is 1..255 if Announce messages are requested only from highest priority master

additionalInfo.para: Changing between the modes requires restart of the ToP resilience functionality

description.para: This object class holds the information for all parameters relevant for phase sync ToP.
This parameter represents the accepted clock quality class.

shortDesc.para: This parameter represents the accepted clock quality class.

additionalInfo.para: "The allowed values represent the IEEE 1588, ITU-T G.8275.1 defined clock classes applicable to clocks related to phase/time synchronization and which a boundary clock might use in case it loses traceability to the original Grandmaster clock.
Note: User needs to be aware that a ToP master operating at arbitrary time scale (CC 13, 14, 58, 193), will offset its ToD related to the used timescale as calculations are based on PTP timescale."

The feature is disabled by default
This indicates how often a ToP sync message shall be send by the ToP master within the transmission duration request period (of 300 seconds).

shortDesc.para: This indicates how often a ToP sync message shall be send by the ToP master within the transmission duration request period (of 300 seconds).

The following values are defined:

pRefDesc.para: Only applicable if topComMode = IP Unicast (0)

feature.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

featureComponent.name: LTE891 Timing over Packet with phase synchronization

description.para: 23-07-2013 Pratima: New parameter created for LTE-891.
-7 means 128 msgs per second
The phase of the output phase of ToP phase synchronization will be adjusted by the value in terms of nanonseconds of this parameter.

shortDesc.para: The phase of the output phase of ToP phase synchronization will be adjusted by the value in terms of nanonseconds of this parameter.

additionalInfo.para: The parameter allows compensation of systematic asymmetric delays at the timing network.

Phase error to be compensated < 0: The recovered phase comes later than the transition of the reference phase. In this case the output phase will be advanced by a time interval equal to the configured value.

Phase error to be compensated > 0: The recovered phase comes earlier than the transition of the reference phase. In this case, the output phase will be delayed by the time interval equal to the configured value.
Note: Parameter should be set/changed at timepoint of commissioning. On-line change is supported too, but network element needs time to adapt and phase might temporary fluctuate.

description.para: 23-07-2013 Pratima: New parameter created for LTE-891.
19-09-2013 Pratima: Additional Info has been modified.
This parameter configures the communication mode for Timing over Packet to be either IP Unicast or Ethernet Multicast.

shortDesc.para: This parameter configures the communication mode for Timing over Packet to be either IP Unicast or Ethernet Multicast.

additionalInfo.para: "IP Unicast is applicable for partial on-path timing network topologies.
Ethernet Multicast is applicable for full on-path timing network topologies,
relating to the full on-path profile as defined at ITU-T G.8275.1. Ethernet Multicast uses the ITU-T G.8275.1 defined Multicast address for ToP."

description.para: 23-07-2013 Pratima: New parameter created for LTE-891.
The Hardware Unit class (UNIT) holds parameters that define the properties of the Flexi Transport Module hardware.

UNIT is a singleton. The Flexi Transport Module contains only 1 unit hardware slot. Exactly 1 instance of UNIT is created at startup by the BTS. The instance cannot be deleted by the management system.
This parameter holds the slot number of the hardware unit of BTS transport. The value is always 1 (only 1 slot is available).

shortDesc.para: This parameter holds the slot number of the hardware unit of BTS transport. The value is always 1 (only 1 slot is available).
